Synopsis:
Maddy aka Madhav Kapoor (Imran Khan) meets Payel and both fall in love almost immediately. Maddy wants a serious relationship, but Payel wants only "Time Pass". Still their mutual attraction gets them into a live-in relationship. Its all hunky dory, until differences start cropping up, with Payel being increasingly intolerant of everything Maddy does.

They break up and Payel disappears. Maddy is convinced that Payel is still in love with him. He refuses to believe that Payel can marry someone else..

The way Maddy gets his Payel back and why she left in the first place, is the story of Katti Batti

Comments:
If there was a movie that defied logic, it is Katti Batti! From the moment Maddy and Payel fall in love to the ultimate end, this story is a series of predictable cliches that we have seen a thousand times. There is everything... even a Devdas Act! Strangely enough, this film actually rests on Imran Khan's shoulders. Kangana Ranaut, the established actress, has little to do till the last stage except look pretty in some ghastly hair-do's. And when she comes on her own, there is very little left to salvage.

Imran Khan, despite the weaknesses of the script, does manage to put across the endearing nature of Maddy. Kangana is wasted in the film and the rest have bit parts that are so overdrawn that they all seem to be part of a vaudeville show! Like most Hindi films there are some lovely scenes shot in exotic locales. Music is pedestrian. There is very little to enthuse ovr this film which is startling in its lack of originality!

See the film if you are in a mood to punish yourself.

Uploader's Notes:
I don't often rip Bollywood movies and have almost given up ripping in X264, but since Mike Khan was away, I stepped in to fill the slot. This DVD upscale is almost as good as the original DVD. Perhaps a bit better than the original as we have been able to mute the garish pink and yellow overtones. I have kept the original AC3 sound (untouched), concentrating only on video quality. It is a bit large at 4.38 GB - 1 DVD5 size, mainly because the original video had a fair amount of detail. which I wanted to preserve in the upscale.

You can judge the quality of the rip from the screenshots which are spaced across the entire movie and from the 2-minute sample that has been provided.
